Greetings to Chief of Palestinian National Authority
articles.content:
Greetings to Chief of Palestinian National Authority 
    Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Sunday sent a message of greetings to Mahmoud Abbas, chief of the Palestinian National Authority, on the occasion of the 42nd anniversary of the start of the Palestinian revolution.
 Expressing firm solidarity with the chief and people of Palestine in their just cause to regain their legitimate national rights including the right to found an independent state with Kuds as its capital, the message sincerely wished him greater success in his work.

articles.title: Greetings to Sudanese President
articles.content:
Greetings to Sudanese President 
    Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Omar Hassan Ahmed Al-Bashir, president of Sudan, on Dec. 31 on the occasion of the 51st anniversary of the independence of the country.
 In the belief that the bilateral ties of friendship and cooperation would consolidate and develop in the mutual interests, the message wished the president of Sudan greater success in his work for the stability and development of the country.

articles.title: Floral Basket to DPRK Embassy in Nigeria
articles.content:
Floral Basket to DPRK Embassy in Nigeria 
    Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- A floral basket was sent to the DPRK embassy in Nigeria by the chief of Staff of Defence of the Nigerian Armed Forces, on the occasion of the 15th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's assumption of office as supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
 Written on the ribbon of the floral basket were letters "Congratulations to Supreme Commander HE Kim Jong Il".    
 The floral basket was laid before a full-length picture of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Anniv. of June Popular Resistance to Be Commemorated in S. Korea
articles.content:
Anniv. of June Popular Resistance to Be Commemorated in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- The Committee for Promoting the Work for Commemorating the 20th Anniversary of the June Popular  Resistance was reportedly inaugurated with due ceremony in Seoul on Dec. 26.
 The ceremony was attended by at least 200 personages of different social standings including Paek Ki Wan, director of the Institute for Reunification Studies.
 The June popular resistance that flared up in 1987 was a mass anti-U.S., anti-fascist struggle of the south Korean people to drive out the U.S. imperialists, put an end to the military fascist dictatorship and achieve democracy and independence in their socio-political life.    
 Noting that the resistance marked a turning point in the movement for democracy in south Korea, the committee decided to conduct activities for setting June 10 next year which would mark the 20th anniversary of the resistance as a commemoration day.
 It also decided to organize diverse seminars, open hearing and other events related to the democratic resistance from January 14 to late June next year, 20 years after Pak Jong Chol died due to the police brutal torture.    
 The ceremony elected permanent co-representatives of the committee.

articles.title: At Least 2,200 Cases of U.S. Aerial Espionage Committed against DPRK in 2006
articles.content:
At Least 2,200 Cases of U.S. Aerial Espionage Committed against DPRK in 2006 
    Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialist aggression forces committed more than 2,200 cases of aerial espionage against the DPRK this year by mobilizing strategic and tactical reconnaissance planes with different missions based overseas and in south Korea, according to a military source. This means six reconnaissance planes were involved in the espionage on a daily average. 
 The number of cases of espionage perpetrated by U-2 reached at least 300 cases.
 The U.S. imperialists periodically infiltrated overseas-based RC-135 into the air above south Korea to commit more than a hundred cases of aerial espionage. 
 Overseas-based E-3 and EP-3 flew into the air above south Korea respectively in the period from Dec. 11 to 14 and in the period from Dec. 14 to 21 to commit over 60 cases of espionage this year.    
 The U.S. imperialists sent at least 120 planes with various missions including RC-7B and RC-12 into the sky over the area along the Military Demarcation Line day and night in December to frantically spy on the front area and the Eastern and Western coastal areas of the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Floral Basket to Cuban Embassy
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Floral Basket to Cuban Embassy 
    Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) ? General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent a basket of flowers to the Cuban embassy here on the occasion of the 48th anniversary of the victory of the Cuban revolution.
 It was conveyed to Ruben Perez Valdes, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK, on Dec. 3

articles.title: New Stamps Issued in DPRK
articles.content:
New Stamps Issued in DPRK
    Pyongyang, December 30 (KCNA) -- The Korea Stamp Corporation has issued stamps on the occasion of the New Year Juche 96 (2007).
 The stamps print the famous Pyongyang Bell which was used to be stricken to signal New Year's Eve and important events in the period of the Ri Dynasty, and animals.
 Reflected in the Pyongyang Bell stamp is the bell with the Taedong Gate, a historical relic, at its background under the letters "A Happy New Year" and "Juche 96 (2007)".
 The animal stamps include a sheetlet, a souvenir sheet and two kinds of individual stamps.    
 Their face value is 3 won, 45 won, 70 won and 130 won respectively.
